byline.contributor: Saba Imtiaz reported from Karachi, and Declan Walsh from London.
byline.original: By SABA IMTIAZ and DECLAN WALSH

abstract: Torrid heat wave hits Karachi, Pakistan, killing at least 650 people as temperatures soar to 113; national hospitals are overwhelmed and army sets up emergency treatment centers in streets.
lead_paragraph: Hospitals declared a state of emergency and authorities closed schools and offices in Karachi, where temperatures have risen to as high as 113 degrees Fahrenheit.

headline.main: Karachi Heat Wave Death Toll Tops 650 During Ramadan Fast
headline.print_headline: Heat Wave’s Unlucky Timing Prompts a Crisis in Pakistan

snippet: Hospitals declared a state of emergency and authorities closed schools and offices in Karachi, where temperatures have risen to as high as 113 degrees Fahrenheit.
